text: English grammar lesson 10 in lesson 9 we
began to talk about how we make changes
to verbs in reported speech first we
looked at subject verb agreement then we
began to talk about changing verb tenses
we're going to continue talking about
verb tenses in this lesson lesson 10 and
I'll explain exactly how verb tenses
change in reported speech the focus of
this lesson will be on one main question
how do verb tenses change in reported
speech before we talk about how verb
tenses change let's remember when they
don't change in reported speech think
back to lesson 9 I gave you some
guidelines to remember when we don't
make changes to verb tenses usually they
will not change if we are reporting
facts or general truths if there's
immediate reporting if the reporting
verb is in the simple present present
perfect or future tense and if this is
very informal conversation in all other
situations we're going to change our
verb tenses how do they change the basic
rule is for all your tenses to shift
back so future and present tenses shift
to past tenses past tense ships to pass
perfect and pass perfect doesn't change
because there's nowhere for it to shift
to let's look at some examples together
we'll start with the future and present
tenses I will buy balloons she said she
would buy balloons will shifts back to
would
I am going to buy balloons she said she
was going to buy balloons I am going to
shifts back to was going to let's go on
I baked cakes
she said she baked cakes the simple
present shifts back to the simple past I
am baking a cake she said she was baking
a cake the present progressive shifts
back to pass progressive I have baked
many cakes she said she had baked many
cakes the present perfect shifts back to
the past perfect now let's look at the
past tenses I wrapped the gifts she said
she had wrapped the gifts the simple
past shifts back to pass perfect I was
wrapping the gifts she said she had been
wrapping the gifts past progressive
shifts back to past perfect progressive
now let's look at the final tool
examples I had wrapped the gifts she
said she had wrapped the gifts I had
been wrapping gifts she said she had
been wrapping the gifts past perfect
tenses do not change remember the basic
guideline to shift verb tenses back
future and present shift to past past
shifts to pass perfect I think you're
ready for our first exercise
[Music]
exercise listen to what Jennifer said
several weeks ago report her words
example listen today is my daughter's
birthday
what's the reported statement remember
that this was several weeks ago we
changed today to that day we're going to
change the verb is to was Jennifer said
that it was her daughter's birthday that
day number one listen she's not home
right now
what's the reported statement answer
Jennifer said that her daughter wasn't
home at the moment - listen I went to
the store to buy her a present
what's the reported statement answer
Jennifer said that she had gone to the
store to buy her daughter a present
three listen I decided to buy this doll
health for her
what's the reported statement answer
Jennifer said that she had decided to
buy that doll house for her daughter for
listen
I think she'll be very surprised and
happy
what's the reported statement answer
Jennifer said that she thought her
daughter would be very surprised and
happy there's still more to come on
reported speech and following lessons
I'll talk about reporting with modal
verbs reporting questions reporting
commands and using other reporting verbs

additional practice is available at

Jennifer ESL there's a follow-up
exercise to this lesson and it's now
available at English cafe comm the
direct link to that exercise is listed

that's all for now thanks for watching
